body_html:
@jdduke I completely agree with you. Correct me if I am wrong, the image_resizer will take care of the size of the input image?

If this is the case then one should not train the model with large input size for eg. 512x512?
Does it mean that if you have a image size other than 300x300 then you have to resize it manually and then use as training and testing data set?

Thank you,

body:
@jdduke  I completely agree with you. Correct me if I am wrong, the image_resizer will take care of the size of the input image? 

If this is the case then one should not train the model with large input size for eg. 512x512? 
Does it mean that if you have a image size other than 300x300 then you have to resize it manually and then use as training and testing data set?

Thank you,
